channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: UPS Store president shares 4 lessons she learned from surviving a ‘widowmaker’ heart attack
item.description: “Now the way I think about setbacks is to say some of them are very far out of our control,” Sarah Casalan says.

item.title: Voters Are Deeply Skeptical About the Health of American Democracy
item.description: Nearly half say it does not do a good job representing the people, and three-quarters say it is under threat, according to a Times/Siena poll.

item.title: Trump and Harris Scrap for Georgia as Supporters Brace for a Photo Finish
item.description: Georgia has seen a flurry of activity underlining both parties’ recognition that, once again, the state is anyone’s to win.

item.title: US approves sale of this advanced missile defense system to Taiwan in $2 billion arms package
item.description: The potential sales package includes three National Advanced Surface-to-Air Missile Systems (NASAMS) and related equipment.

item.title: For Catholic Jubilee, Days of Joy and Sadness in Rome and Bethlehem
item.description: For Rome, the rare Christmas Eve rite of redemption is cause for celebration this year. For Bethlehem, it is another grim reminder of the generations ...

item.title: Gelato Godfather: Inside the Sicilian ice cream empire built on mafia money
item.description: Over two-thirds of mafia infiltrations are in the construction, trade, real estate and manufacturing sectors.

item.title: Amid Talk of Fascism, Trump’s Threats and Language Evoke a Grim Past

item.title: Live Updates: Iran’s Leaders Stress Their Right to Respond to Israel’s Strikes

item.title: Inside The Washington Post’s Decision to Stop Presidential Endorsements
item.description: Post owner Jeff Bezos ended the decades-long practice, weeks after a discussion at a meeting in Miami. The move has drawn criticism in and outside the...

item.title: Republic of Georgia’s Ruling Party Claims Election Victory
item.description: The Georgian Dream party won 54 percent of the vote, the electoral commission said Sunday, a result that critics of the government fear could derail t...

item.title: At Vatican Synod, Women’s Issues Are Relegated to a Side Group
item.description: A meeting four years in the making said the ordination of women required further study, but it called for women to have more leadership roles, even in...

item.title: Jamie Dimon and Bill Gates won’t publicly criticize Trump because they need leverage in the next political firestorm, ‘CEO whisperer’ says: ‘They have to keep their powder dry’
item.description: Yale management professor Jeffrey Sonnenfeld said CEOs’ political silence is purely strategic.

item.title: Heroes of the high-rate economy? Bank of America praises consumers for propping up 2024
item.description: Bank of America outlines a healthy consumer outlook for holiday spending and the property sector.

item.title: A Springfield Bus Accident Killed Their Son. Then Politics Made It Worse.

item.title: Tropical Storm Trami Hits Vietnam After Killing Dozens in the Philippines
item.description: The storm made landfall near Danang on Sunday after leaving at least 80 people dead last week.
